briefTitle: Safety, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, and Efficacy of Migalastat in Pediatric Subjects (Aged 12 to <18 Years)
officialTitle: An Open-label Study of the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, and Efficacy of 12 Month Treatment With Migalastat in Pediatric Subjects (Aged 12 to <18 Years) With Fabry Disease and Amenable GLA Variants
summary: This was an open-label study to evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics (PK), pharmacodynamics (PD), and efficacy of migalastat treatment in pediatric participants 12 to \<18 years of age with Fabry disease and amenable gene encoding Î±-galactosidase A (GLA) variants.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number Of Participants Who Experienced Treatment-related Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Day 1 (after dosing) through Month 12 and follow-up (30 days after last dose)
